page.title: 02Finchingfield,Roads,Rivers.
page.content: The main drainage in the area is from the north to south. The stream from Sculpins Farm runs through Duck End into the centre of Finchingfied where it is widened into a duck pond. It is known as Finchingfield Brook and runs south to meet the River Pant just north of Bardfield.Another stream in the centre of the area is widened into an artifical lake near Petches Farm before meeting the Pant which flows away south-west to Braintree. The road that runs from the Sampfords to Braintree is the B1053. The road that runs from Haverhill to Great Dunmow is called the B1057.These roads meet in Finchingfield and form a crossroads. The B1053 road goes down in the direction of South east.The B1057 runs in the direction of the South west.
